intro: Seseli gigas, commonly known as giant seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe, including parts of the Alps and the Carpathians. The plant is characterized by its tall, unbranched stem and large, compound leaves that can reach several feet in length. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Seseli gigas is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cooler, high-altitude environments.
